sourceMeaningMnemonic: If someone gives you a <radical>sock</radical> you should <kanji>receive</kanji> it and thank them. You can't just say no or put the sock on the ground and walk away. You should always receive a sock properly, with both hands, when it's handed to you.
meaningInfo: Imagine Dobby reaching out to receive his first sock. Don't you want to be happy like that too?
readingMnemonic: The best place to <kanji>receive</kanji> a sock is in <ja><reading>きょう</reading>と</ja>. They're famous for their sock stores and schoolgirls who have too many socks. If you walk down the street someone is bound to try to hand you a sock in <ja>きょうと</ja>, and you should receive it happily.
readingInfo: Imagine standing in <ja>きょうと</ja> and receiving sock after sock. People just keep giving and you keep receiving!
